resources.string: Use this checklist, to make sure you\'re prepared!
Food! one ration per person per meal!! You want enough for 3 days!
A battery powered radio, or a hand crank radio. A NOAA Weather Radio with tone alert is recommended.
Flashlights!!! (good idea to have more than one!)
Extra Batteries, for radio and flashlights
A whistle to signal for help; this lets emergency responders know you are in distress
A Dust mask; to help filter contaminated air
Plastic sheeting and duct tape to shelter in place.
Moist towletes, dry shampoo, mouthwash, and other personal hygiene items.
Garbage bags and plastic ties for personal sanitation
Wrench or Pliers to turn off utilities. Also any other tools you could think of.
If your kit contains canned food, you\'ll need a can opener, so be sure to include one! (maybe even two to be safe)
Any Local maps that you may need. Its a good idea to print them out ahead of time.
Cell phones, chargers, and a backup portable charger are always a great tool. Just make sure they\'re charged!!
